# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

from PIL import Image
from matplotlib.pyplot import imshow
%matplotlib inline
# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os

list_of_image_path = []
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('../input/gta-vice-city-car-driving-images-with-label'):
    for filename in filenames:
        
        list_of_image_path.append(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
        #print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session

# sample.png is the name of the image
# file and assuming that it is uploaded
# in the current directory or we need

# to give the path
for i in list_of_image_path:
    image = Image.open(i)
  
    # summarize some details about the image
    print(image.format)
    print(image.size)
    print(image.mode)
    imshow(np.asarray(image))
    break
source.b070661d:
**Introduction**

This dataset is a part of 20 games (1/20) where I intend to make a generalized model for self-driving car in PC gaming environment robust to new games. Later, I found GTA-5 dataset is enough to do so and decided to public all the gathered data for Research purposes.

Initial version of this data contained 1000 images snapped at 500ms interval of time which were later filtered by me to around 510 images.

Format of the file is the indication of it labels i.e., XXX_WASD where XXX represent the id of the image and WASD represent the keys to accelerate, move left, reverse accelerate, move right respectively present at current interval of 500ms previous to snapped image.

Owner of this dataset can be considered as unknown; it is free to use for any purpose.

Feel free to ask any question in discussion forms and more data to this dataset will be added shortly.
